summary: This document is an email chain from April 2021 discussing a follow-up inquiry regarding records from the Professional Children's School (PCS) related to Jeffrey Epstein. The emails involve Assistant U.S. Attorneys from the Southern District of New York and an external attorney, Gary Stein, regarding potential third-party payments, donations, or scholarships connected to Epstein from 1997 to 2000.

persons.name: Gary Stein
persons.role: Partner at Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP
persons.context: External attorney who is being contacted by the U.S. Attorney's Office regarding records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein.

persons.name: Elizabeth Sullivan
persons.context: CC'd on the email chain, indicating involvement in the inquiry regarding Epstein-related records from the Professional Children's School.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The inquiry focuses on obtaining records from the Professional Children's School related to third-party payments, donations, or scholarships connected to him during 1997-2000.

connections.description: Gary Stein is in email communication with Elizabeth Sullivan and other AUSAs regarding records related to Jeffrey Epstein.
Gary Stein is being asked by the U.S. Attorney's Office to help obtain school records potentially connected to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Email follow-up on PCS records
events.description: An AUSA indicates they will reach out the next day regarding records from the Professional Children's School related to Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Initial inquiry about PCS records
events.description: An AUSA emails Gary Stein asking if the Professional Children's School has records of third-party payments, donations, or scholarships related to Jeffrey Epstein from 1997 to 2000.

keyFacts: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York was actively investigating Jeffrey Epstein's financial connections to the Professional Children's School as of 2021.
The investigation sought records from 1997 to 2000 regarding third-party payments, donations, sponsored scholarships, or similar financial transactions related to Epstein.
The inquiry involved external attorney Gary Stein of Schulte Roth & Zabel LLP, suggesting the school may have retained legal counsel regarding the records request.
The email chain indicates the initial subpoena may not have covered all potential financial records, prompting a follow-up for an updated subpoena.
